content.description: Stand start with hands matched on an edge five feet off the deck. From there, dyno to an edge above and match on it, then work right to a jug, set the feet, and commit to the slab for the send.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is good throughout, but there are rocks guarding the landing.
content.location: It climbs the west section of Isosplitter's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand crimp. From there, make a big move to a right hand edge, reconnect the feet, follow with the left hand along the arete, then stick a right hand on the opposing arete, throw a heel over, and mantel onto the boulder.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. It's a lowball, but there is a rock just left of the sit that may come into play if you miss the first move and the finish climbs over a rock as well.
content.location: It climbs the center of Isosplitter's south face.

content.description: Sit start on the rock at the lip. From there, traverse left through edges and bumps to reach the apex, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will be nice. The landing has a sizeable rock that pads well.
content.location: It climbs the east section of Isosplitter's south face.
